intro: Murdannia simplex, commonly known as the slender murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Murdannia simplex is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
